dt: {bc}a closed plane {dx_def}see {dxt|plane:6||2b}{/dx_def} curve every point of which is equidistant {dx_def}see {dxt|equidistant||1}{/dx_def} from a fixed point within the curve
{bc}the plane surface bounded by such a curve
{bc}something in the form of a circle or section of a circle: such as
{bc}an instrument of astronomical observation the graduated {dx_def}see {dxt|graduated|| 2a}{/dx_def} limb of which consists of an entire circle
{bc}a balcony or tier of seats in a theater
{bc}a circle formed on the surface of a sphere by the intersection of a plane that passes through it
{bc}fallacious reasoning in which something to be demonstrated is covertly assumed
{bc}a group of persons sharing a common interest or revolving about a common center
{bc}a territorial or administrative division or district

dt.t: The province is divided into nine {wi}circles{/wi}.
The children ran in {wi}circles{/wi} around the tree.
The conversation kept going in {wi}circles{/wi}, and nothing got accomplished.

art.capt: circle 1b: {it}AB{/it} diameter; {it}C{/it} center; {it}CD, CA, CB{/it} radii; {it}EKF{/it} arc on chord {it}EF; EFKL{/it} (area) segment on chord {it}EF; ACD{/it} (area) sector; {it}GH{/it} secant; {it}TPM{/it} tangent at point {it}P; EKFBPDA{/it} circumference

et: Middle English {it}cercle{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}circulus{/it}, diminutive of {it}circus{/it} circle, circus, from or akin to Greek {it}krikos, kirkos{/it} ring; akin to Old English {it}hring{/it} ring {ma}{mat|ring|}{/ma}
shortdef: a closed plane curve every point of which is equidistant from a fixed point within the curve
the plane surface bounded by such a curve

dt: {bc}to enclose in or as if in a circle
{bc}to move in or as if in a circle

dt.t: The airplane {it}circled{/it} around over the airport.
thy name shall {wi}circle{/wi} round the gaping throng

dt: {bc}to circle around before making an attack
{bc}to describe or extend in a circle

dt.t: the lighthouse sent out its slow steady {it}circling{/it} beam

shortdef: to enclose in or as if in a circle
to move in or as if in a circle

dt.t: We've been driving {it}in circles{/it} for hours!
We've been trying to decide how to improve the system, but we just keep going around {it}in circles{/it} and not making any progress.

shortdef: along the same path or course

dt: {bc}the parallel of latitude that is approximately 66¹/₂ degrees south of the equator and that circumscribes the southern frigid zone

shortdef: the parallel of latitude that is approximately 661/2 degrees south of the equator and that circumscribes the southern frigid zone

dt: {bc}the parallel of latitude that is approximately 66¹/₂ degrees north of the equator and that circumscribes the northern frigid zone

shortdef: the parallel of latitude that is approximately 661/2 degrees north of the equator and that circumscribes the northern frigid zone

dt: {bc}a geometric and especially a circular pattern of flattened stalks in a field of grain now usually attributed to natural phenomena or to the work of hoaxers trying to create the impression of a visit by extraterrestrial beings

shortdef: a geometric and especially a circular pattern of flattened stalks in a field of grain now usually attributed to natural phenomena or to the work of hoaxers trying to create the impression of a visit by extraterrestrial beings

dt: {bc}the first or lowest curved tier of seats above the main floor in a theater or opera house

shortdef: the first or lowest curved tier of seats above the main floor in a theater or opera house

dt: {bc}a circle formed on the surface of a sphere by the intersection of a plane that passes through the center of the sphere
{bc}such a circle on the surface of the earth an arc of which connecting two terrestrial points constitutes the shortest distance on the earth's surface between them

shortdef: a circle formed on the surface of a sphere by the intersection of a plane that passes through the center of the sphere; specifically : such a circle on the surface of the earth an arc of which connecting two terrestrial points constitutes the shortest distance on the earth's surface between them

dt: {bc}a circle on the celestial sphere that passes through both celestial poles

shortdef: a circle on the celestial sphere that passes through both celestial poles
